chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery (939.05 Party to a Crime)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ariana J Bellamy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
If defendant serves her sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of her prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION or EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Anger management counseling.
No controlled substances or alcohol. No contact with victim, Kayla T and her child A.G.
AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens.
Obtain HSED/GED. Seek and maintain employment and/or school. Job/vocational training. Cognitive thinking therapy.
Pay restitution in the amount of $794.00 to be paid to Kayla T. joint and several with Children's Court case 14JV000142.

Provide a DNA sample and pay appropriate costs. Pay costs, fees and assessments and supervision fees to be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgement that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.  If defendant serves her sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of her prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.
As a convicted felon defendant may not possess any firearms or body armor.
As a convicted felon defendant's voting rights are restricted until they are restored.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence with the following conditions to be met:
- follow all terms and conditions of probation.
- follow all terms and conditions of PO agent.
- pay restitution and restitution surcharge with no reduction
  to civil judgment.
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work and school. Good time to apply. Defendant's report date is 6-25-14 at 5:00 pm.
Imposed and STAYED. To be used at the discretion of the PO agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ariana J Bellamy

records.addlTxt:
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence with the following conditions to be met:
- follow all terms and conditions of probation
- follow all terms and conditions of PO agent
- pay restitution and restitution surcharge with not reduction to civil judgment
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause

Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Sentencing proceeded.  State has satisfied victim notification.  Filed with the court:  letters of support on behalf of the defendant, victim impact statement and restitution worksheet.  Parties stipulate to restitution amount.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Samotria M.
The Court imposed the following sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 42 months consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 18 months with credit for 4 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 24 months on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.    The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant. 
The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION OR EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- no controlled substances or alcohol
- AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens
- obtain HSED/GED
- anger management counseling
- no contact with victim, Kayla T and her child A.G.
- pay restitution in the amount of $794.00 to be paid to Kayla T. joint and several with Children's Court case 14JV000142
- seek and maintain employment and/or school
- job/vocational training
- cognitive thinking therapy
- provide a DNA sample and pay appropriate costs
- serve 120 days conditions time: 60 days in the HOC with huber for work and school and 60 days imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the PO agent.  Good time to apply.  Defendant report date is 6-25-2014 at 5:00 pm.
- as a convicted felon defendant may not possess any firearms or body armour
- as a convicted felon defendant's voting rights are restricted until they are restored
- pay costs, fees and assessments and supervision fees to be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgement that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.  If defendant serves her sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of her prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.
Filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Sentencing Referral Form, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered.  Victim notification needed; sentencing will be continued.  Defense counsel's request for a date after June 12 was agreed upon by the State and granted by the Court to allow defendant to finish school.  Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:

Theft (Value $2,500 to $5,000), as a Party to a Crime, a Class I Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. sections 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(bf)  and 939.05.
Justice Point report received and filed.  Defendant now compliant. rn
Violation report from Milwaukee County Pretrial Services, received and filed.  Defendant missed a phone contact. rn

Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from Justice Point, received and filed. rn
/from Justice Point, filed. rn

Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  DeAnn L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties still negotiating; defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All conditions of bail continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Randy Sitzberger for DeAnn L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/14/14.
css

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kayla T., her children and O.N.D.

Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Ariana J Bellamy in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
